answers.answer: Nothing to worry about. I had them done with all three of my children. I was 18,20, and 27 for my pregancies. They hook you up to a fetal monitor and give you orange juice or something else to make the baby move. Each time you feel the baby you have to push a button that they give you to hold. The worse part is laying there...BORING!!!  I'm sure all will be fine. My last pregnancy was 13 years ago but I'm sure they haven't changed all that much! I am ttc now myself and would love to have to go through anything at this point!!...LOL! Best of luck and breathe...it will be ok.

Ditto to what Momof8215 posted.  I did it too. The worse part is it is BORING.  They usually do this for all women of advanced age, just a precautionary measure to monitor your baby's heartbeat and your contractions if you're having any...bring a book : )
Yup, I got one done as well.  I'm 36.  NOTHING to worry about!
I had them twice a week for the last 6 weeks for insulin dependent gestational diabetes

question: Hello All,I had my 30 week office visit today.  Everything looked real good and the doctor is really pleased with how the pregnancy is progressing.  She did state that she wants me to have a non-stress test for the baby in two weeks and then again 2 weeks after that.  She said it's just a precaution b/c of my age (39) and my history of m/c's (3 of them).  Has anybody else had the non-stress tests done??  I may have to have it done for the last 4 weeks of my pregnancy as well just to monitor the baby.
title: Non-Stress Tests
